pr_title: fix: ensure only deserializable cmds are written to command topic

timeline.message:
fix: ensure only deserializable cmds are written to command topic

fixes: https://github.com/confluentinc/ksql/issues/5643

Ensures all commands written to the command topic can be deserialized before writing them.

A non-deserializable command causes the command runner thread to die.
Even restarting the server won't help as the server will stop when it hits the non-deserializable command again.

This adds some level of protection.

timeline.bodyText: I suppose this isn't strictly true if the version reading is different than the version writing; but I'm not opposed to the extra safety net 😛
timeline.author: agavra

Any command that can't be deserialized is a bug. However, given a non-deserializable + * command will kill the command runner thread, this is a safety net to ensure commands written to + * the command topic can be deserialzied.
